an1.333-377:4.1: “Just as, mendicants, in India the delightful parks, woods, meadows, and lotus ponds are few,
an1.333-377:4.2: while the hilly terrain, rivers hard to cross, stumps and thorns, and rugged mountains are many;
an1.333-377:4.3: so too the sentient beings born on land are few, while those born in water are many.
an1.333-377:6.1: … so too the sentient beings reborn as humans are few,
an1.333-377:6.2: while those not reborn as humans are many.
an1.333-377:7.1: … so too the sentient beings reborn in civilized countries are few,
an1.333-377:7.2: while those reborn in the borderlands, among barbarian tribes, are many.
an1.333-377:9.1: … so too the sentient beings who are wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish the well said from the poorly said are few,
an1.333-377:9.2: while the sentient beings who are witless, dull, stupid, and unable to distinguish the well said from the poorly said are many.
an1.333-377:11.1: … so too the sentient beings who have the noble eye of wisdom are few,
an1.333-377:11.2: while those who are ignorant and confused are many.
an1.333-377:13.1: … so too the sentient beings who get to see a Realized One are few,
an1.333-377:13.2: while those who don’t get to see a Realized One are many.
an1.333-377:15.1: … so too the sentient beings who get to hear the teaching and training announced by a Realized One are few,
an1.333-377:15.2: while those sentient beings who don’t get to hear the teaching and training announced by a Realized One are many.
an1.333-377:17.1: … so too the sentient beings who remember the teachings they hear are few,
an1.333-377:17.2: while those who don’t remember the teachings are many.
an1.333-377:19.1: … so too the sentient beings who examine the meaning of the teachings they have memorized are few,
an1.333-377:19.2: while those who don’t the meaning of the teachings are many.
an1.333-377:21.1: … so too the sentient beings who understand the meaning and the teaching and practice accordingly are few,
an1.333-377:21.2: while those who understand the meaning and the teaching but don’t practice accordingly are many.
an1.333-377:23.1: … so too the sentient beings inspired by awe-inspiring things are few,
an1.333-377:23.2: while those who are uninspired are many.
an1.333-377:25.1: … so too the sentient beings who, being inspired, make the right kind of effort are few,
an1.333-377:25.2: while those who, even though inspired, don’t make the right kind of effort are many.
an1.333-377:27.1: … so too the sentient beings who, relying on letting go, get samādhi, get unification of mind are few,
an1.333-377:27.2: while those who don’t get samādhi, don’t get unification of mind relying on letting go are many.
an1.333-377:29.1: … so too the sentient beings who get the best food and flavors are few,
an1.333-377:29.2: while those who don’t get the best food and flavors, but get by with scraps in an alms bowl are many.
an1.333-377:31.1: … so too the sentient beings who get the essence of the meaning, the essence of the teaching, and the essence of freedom are few,
an1.333-377:31.2: while the sentient beings who don’t get the essence of the meaning, the essence of the teaching, and the essence of freedom are many.
an1.333-377:31.3: So you should train like this:
an1.333-377:31.4: ‘We will get the essence of the meaning, the essence of the teaching, the essence of freedom.’
an1.333-377:33.1: “Just as, mendicants, in India the delightful parks, woods, meadows, and lotus ponds are few,
an1.333-377:33.2: while the hilly terrain, rivers hard to cross, stumps and thorns, and rugged mountains are many;
an1.333-377:33.3: so too, those who die as humans and are reborn as humans are few, while those who die as humans and are reborn in hell, or the animal realm, or the ghost realm are many.”

an1.333-377:35.2: while those who die as humans and are reborn in hell, or the animal realm, or the ghost realm are many.”
